Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Public Safety

Items.Title: Oversight - Oversight:  The Department of Education's Policy Banning Cell Phones in Public Schools
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Oversight:  The Department of Education's Policy Banning Cell Phones in Public Schools

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing schoolchildren to carry cellular phones to and from school.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Allowing schoolchildren to carry cellular phones to and from school for safety purposes.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Public Safety

Resolution calling on the Department of Education (“DOE”) to place a moratorium on the confiscation of students’ cellular phones during random searches of middle and high schools, to immediately convene public hearings in every community school district to discuss its policy banning cellular phones in public schools and to develop, in consultation with all interested parties, an alternative policy governing the presence of cellular phones on school property.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Place a moratorium on the confiscation of students’ cellular phones during random searches of middle and high schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the education law, in relation to the use and possession of cellular telephones by students.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Use and possession of mobile telephones by students.
